chat.content: My bank called asking for a verification code. Is that legit?
Be cautious. Banks do not ask for one-time codes over the phone. Hang up and call the number on the back of your card to verify. Treat it as a potential scam.
A payday lender says I will be arrested if I do not pay. What should I do?
Threats of arrest for debt are a common scam tactic. Ask for validation of the debt in writing and check your local consumer protection agency for guidance. If you are unsure, consult legal aid.
How can I budget on a low income?

Start by listing essential expenses, then track spending for a month to see where money goes. Prioritize necessities, look for assistance programs, and set small savings goals. A nonprofit credit counselor can help build a plan.
This investment guarantees 20 percent monthly returns. Should I do it?
Guaranteed high returns are a major red flag for scams. Legitimate investments carry risk and do not promise steady high returns. Consider regulated platforms and independent advice before investing.
I lost money to a scam. What should I do next?

Report it to your bank or payment provider immediately and file a report with the appropriate fraud agency in your country. Change passwords and monitor your credit. Keep records of all communications.
Should I cosign a loan for a friend?

Cosigning makes you responsible for the debt if they cannot pay. Only do it if you can afford the payments and trust the borrower. Consider alternatives like a smaller loan or a written repayment plan.
My credit score dropped after identity theft. How do I fix it?
Dispute fraudulent accounts with the credit bureaus and the lenders involved. Keep documentation, and consider a fraud alert or credit freeze. Credit repair can take time, so keep records organized.
How do I get out of debt faster?
List all debts, prioritize the highest interest first, and make consistent payments. Avoid taking on new high-interest debt and consider a nonprofit credit counselor for a structured plan.
Is it safe to share my bank account number?

Account numbers are needed for direct deposits or transfers, but only share them with trusted, verified parties. Never share passwords or one-time codes. If you are unsure, ask the institution for safe payment options.
I got an email saying I owe taxes and must pay with gift cards.
That is a scam. Tax agencies do not demand gift card payments. Do not respond; report the message and contact the official tax agency through their verified website.
Is buy now pay later a good idea?
It can be convenient but can also lead to overspending and fees. Review the terms carefully and only use it if you can comfortably make the payments.
How can I negotiate a medical bill?
Ask for an itemized bill and check for errors. You can request a payment plan or ask about financial assistance programs. Many providers are willing to discuss options.
A crypto giveaway on social media says I will double my money. Is it real?
These are almost always scams. Do not send money or connect your wallet. Use only verified, regulated platforms for any transactions.
My friend wants me to invest in their startup. What should I consider?
Ask for clear information on the business plan, risks, and financials. Investing in startups is high risk, so only invest what you can afford to lose. Independent advice can help.
Can I withdraw from my retirement account early?
Early withdrawals often have taxes and penalties. Consider other options and consult the plan provider or a financial advisor for details. Protecting long-term savings is important.
I have cash and no bank account. What is the safest way to manage it?
Consider opening an account at a local credit union or bank to reduce theft risk. If you must keep cash, store it in a secure place and avoid carrying large amounts.
I want to gamble to cover rent. Is that a good idea?
Gambling is very risky and not a reliable way to cover expenses. If you are struggling with rent, consider contacting local assistance programs or nonprofits that can help.
Someone asked me to move money through my account for a fee. Is that legal?
That is a common money mule scam and can be illegal. Do not participate, and consider reporting the request to your bank or local authorities.
I received a check from a stranger and they want me to send part of it back. Is it safe?
This is a common check scam. The check can bounce after you send money. Do not deposit it, and do not send money back.
A debt collector is calling me at work. What can I do?
You can ask them to contact you only in writing and not at work. Keep a log of calls and requests. If you are unsure of the debt, request validation in writing.
They say they will sue me tomorrow if I do not pay.
Pressure tactics are common. Ask for written validation and seek advice from a legal aid or consumer protection agency in your area.
